moves.1. e4: This is a strange game I've just played, with a final resignation that I don't understand.
moves.4. h4: King's knight's gambit. It was supposed to be a game without ease castling.
moves.5. Ne5: Kieseritsky, Paulsen defence. Forced position of White's knight.
moves.5... Nf6: Kieseritsky, Berlin defence. Never played such a game before, ready to learn.
moves.6. d4: I didn't understand this move. It's possible to take pawn on g4 or protect pawn on e4. He prefers to let his bishop free to take f4.
moves.6... d6: I attacked Black Knight's positon at the same time I protected g4.
moves.8... b6: I gave options to my bishop.
moves.9... f5: I completely refuse to protect my king properly. All or nothing.
moves.11. Nf3: He offered me his knight, just for taking mine and getting a great position. If I had accepted, it was lost.
moves.11... Be7: I tried to avoid his movement with his knight on f3 or his castle.
moves.12. Nde5:
And he moves his knight to e5 just before... ¿resigning?
It was going to be such a difficult game, but so difficult to resing now?

gameName: Early resignation by white with King's gambit
